data.text:
On stage, in movies and on TV, Susannah Harker has her footprints taped into every corner of the acting industry. The triple threat actress has been entertaining audiences with her contemporary and classic works for over three decades, with more than thirty projects to her name. His popular acting roles are House of Cards (1990), A Dry White Season (1989), as well as A Caribbean Dream (2017).

Susanna Harker is not the only artist in the family. Discover all the facts about the life and career of the English actress that may interest you as you read.

Susannah Harker – Biography

On April 26, 1965, Susannah Harker was born in London, England. Her name was Susannah M Owens at birth. The actress grew up in a Catholic family with her siblings and was raised as such. She studied at a strict convent boarding school in Sussex and, after being cared for by the school’s nuns, continued her education at the Central School of Speech and Drama in North London, where she continued. prepared for a career in the performing arts.

She made her film debut in 1985 as Bessie Wills Burke & Wills and throughout the rest of the 1980s she played several roles in films and on television. Some of the appearances she made during this time were The Lady Is Not to Burn (1987), The Fear (1988), Troubles (1988) and A Dry White Season (1989). She ushered in the 90s with her role as Mattie Stoorin in House of Cards followed by Irene St. Claire in the film The Blood Crucifer and the Chancer series (1990-1991) – where she played the role of Joanna Franklyn in 14 episodes. The rest of the 90s saw her perform atSurviving Picasso (film) in 1996 and TV shows The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes, Faith, Pride and Prejudice, Warmth of the Sun and Ultraviolet from 1994 to 1998.

After appearing in the films Always Broken Down in the Same Car, Intimacy, Trance, Offensive Angels and The Call between 2001 and 2008, she left the film department to focus on television. From 2001 to 2010, Susannah Harker made television appearances on shows including Murder in Mind, Walking the Dead, Midsomer Murders, and On the Way. His most recent television roles were on the set of Young James Herriot (2011), New Tricks (2012) and Grantchester (2017).

Some of her stage performances have been in productions of Abigail’s Party and Three Sisters.

Family

Susannah Harker was born into a family with a long list of artists. Her parents are actress Polly Adams and actor Richard Owens. Her father starred in popular TV series like The Avengers and The Mayor of Casterbridge while her mother is popular for her role in Just William. Susannah’s sisters, Nelly Harker and Caroline Harker, are also actresses. Caroline practices her craft both on screen and on stage.

Going deeper into her roots, Joseph Harker, a renowned artist and theater designer is her great-great-grandfather. In addition, Gordon Harker, actor of English cinema and theater is her great uncle, while she is the sister-in-law of Anthony Calf.

On a personal level of her life, Susannah has her own family which she built with actor Iain Glen. They dated for a while before getting married in 1993. Their family grew in 1994 with the arrival of their son whom they named Finlay. Sadly, just after ten years of dating, Glen and Harker separated after a divorce in 2004. The next time she came on the radar, Susannah was dating actor Paul McGann, but the relationship didn’t go away. maintained.. Both lasted from 2006 to 2008.
